itemDescription: British RAF aviator and officer, killed during the Battle of Britain

wikipedia_page.main: David Arthur Coke, DFC, ( KUUK; 4 December 1915 – 9 December 1941) was a flight lieutenant in the Royal Air Force Volunteer Reserve during the Second World War, and is credited with two destroyed, two probables, and two damaged aircraft during his service. He is known in popular culture for his friendship with the author Roald Dahl while serving in the Royal Air Force.
